intro: Greuteria membranacea, commonly known as the membranous greuteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
